application.doc: Retrieving a list of all server connections

param.name: appliance_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

method.name: GET
method.doc: To complete this operation with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP GET command on the runtime servers resource URI.

param.name: Authorization
param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

response.doc: There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting

param.name: message
param.doc: The error message.

response.doc: File not Found, The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting

param.name: message
param.doc: The error message.

response.doc: An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting

param.name: message
param.doc: The error message.

response.doc: 200 OK Content-Type:application/json { "jdbc": [ { "connection": { "user": "isamUser", "password": "***", "serverName": "oracle.isam-test.ibm.com", "portNumber": "401", "ssl": true, "serviceName": "isamService", "type": "thin" }, "connectionManager": { "agedTimeout": "20s", "connectionTimeout": "1m30s", "minPoolSize": 5, "maxPoolSize": 20, "purgePolicy": "ValidateAllConnections", "reapTime": "30s", "maxConnectionsPerThread": 5, "numConnectionsPerThreadLocal": 10 }, "jndiId": "oracleTest", "type": "oracle", "name": "OracleTestConnection", "description": "An test connection to an Oracle database", "locked": false, "uuid": "22b9365a-e473-4ec0-8445-f9d221a6dad3" }, { "connection": { "user": "isamUser", "password": "***", "serverName": "db2.isam-test.ibm.com", "portNumber": "400", "ssl": true, }, "jndiId": "db2Test", "type": "db2", "name": "DB2TestConnection", "description": "An test connection to a DB2 database", "locked": false, "uuid": "2d99b88e-d9f1-40b7-89da-f4b24ae6d37f" }, { "connection": { "user": "isamUser", "password": "***", "serverName": "postgres.isam-test.ibm.com", "portNumber": "2020", "ssl": true, "databaseName": "testdb" }, "connectionManager": { "agedTimeout": "20s", "connectionTimeout": "1m30s", "minPoolSize": 5, "maxPoolSize": 20, "purgePolicy": "ValidateAllConnections", "reapTime": "30s", "maxConnectionsPerThread": 5, "numConnectionsPerThreadLocal": 10 }, "jndiId": "postgresqlTest", "type": "postgresql", "name": "PostgreSQLTestConnection", "description": "An test connection to a PostgreSQL database", "locked": false, "uuid": "66e114b1-ddce-4558-95ae-0e60dda1018a " }, ... ], "ldap": [ { "connection": { "hostName": "ldap.isam-test.ibm.com", "hostPort": "389", "bindDN": "cn=root", "bindPwd": "***", "ssl": false }, "connectionManager": { "connectTimeout": "30", }, "type": "ldap", "name": "LdapTestConnection", "description": "A test connection to an LDAP server", "locked": false, "uuid": "56e114b1-ddce-4558-95ae-0e60dda1018b" }, ... ], "smtp": [ { "connection": { "hostName": "smtp.isam-test.ibm.com", "hostPort": 587, "user": "isamUser", "ssl": false }, "56e114b1-ddce-4558-95ae-0e60dda1018c" }, ... ], "ws": [ { "connection": { "url": "https://id.ibm.com:444/scim", "user": "easuser", "ssl": true, "sslTruststore": "rt_profile_keys.kdb", "sslAuthKey": "connection": { "adminHost": "example.verify.ibm.com", "clientId": "aBWWlwp21h", "clientSecret": "ZUhkjjmSItkTD3w3tsYs", "ssl": true, "sslTruststore": "rt_profile_keys.kdb", "sslAuthKey": "service-key", "usersEndpoint": "/v2.0/Users", "authorizeEndpoint": "/v1.0/endpoint/default/token", "authenticatorsEndpoint": "/v1.0/authenticators", "authnmethodsEndpoint": "/v1.0/authnmethods", param.name: name
param.doc: The name given for this connection.

param.name: description
param.doc: A description of the connection.

param.name: uuid
param.doc: A unique identifier for this connection. (Automatically generated, only visible in responses)

param.name: locked
param.doc: Whether the connection is allowed to be deleted. If not present, a default of 'false' will be assumed, except when updating an existing connection, where the existing lock status will be assumed.

param.name: type
param.doc: The type of database this is a connection to. Valid types are: oracle, db2, soliddb, postgresql

param.name: jndiId
param.doc: The internal JNDI id used to reference this connection. (Only alphanumeric characters are acceptable for this field.)

param.doc: The connection properties.

param.doc: The name given for this connection.

param.name: description
param.doc: A description of the connection.

param.name: uuid
param.doc: A unique identifier for this connection. (Automatically generated, only visible in responses)

param.name: locked
param.doc: Controls whether the connection is allowed to be deleted. If not present, a default of 'false' will be assumed, except when updating an existing connection, where the existing lock status will be assumed.

param.name: type

param.name: connection
param.doc: The connection properties.

param.name: connectionManager
param.doc: The connection manager properties.

param.name: servers
param.doc: Additional Redis servers for this connection. This is only valid if the connection deploymentModel is set as sentinel.

param.name: serverName
param.doc: The IP address or hostname of the database.

param.name: portNumber
param.doc: The port that the database is listening on.

param.name: ssl
param.doc: Controls whether SSL is used to establish the connection.

param.name: user
param.doc: The user name used to to authenticate with the database.

param.name: password
param.doc: The password used to to authenticate with the database. Note: The password is not returned in responses. When updating a connection, this parameter is optional.

param.name: type
param.doc: The Oracle JDBC driver type. Valid types are (thin, oci) (Only applicable for Oracle connection, this parameter is required for all Oracle connections.)

param.name: serviceName
param.doc: The name of the database service to connect to. (Only applicable for Oracle connections, this parameter is required for all Oracle connections.)

param.name: databaseName
param.doc: The name of the database to connect to. (Only applicable for DB2 and PostgreSQL connections, this parameter is required for all DB2 and PostgreSQL connections.)

param.name: agedTimeout
param.doc: Amount of time before a physical connection can be discarded by pool maintenance. A value of -1 disables this timeout. Specify a positive integer followed by a unit of time, which can be hours (h), minutes (m), or seconds (s). For example, specify 30 seconds as 30s. You can include multiple values in a single entry. For example, 1m30s is equivalent to 90 seconds. (Default value: "-1")

param.name: connectionTimeout
param.doc: Amount of time after which a connection request times out. A value of -1 disables this timeout. Specify a positive integer followed by a unit of time, which can be hours (h), minutes (m), or seconds (s). For example, specify 30 seconds as 30s. You can include multiple values in a single entry. For example, 1m30s is equivalent to 90 seconds. (Default value: "30s")

param.name: maxConnectionsPerThread
param.doc: Limits the number of open connections on each thread.

param.name: maxIdleTime
param.doc: Amount of time after which an unused or idle connection can be discarded during pool maintenance, if doing so does not reduce the pool below the minimum size. A value of -1 disables this timeout. Specify a positive integer followed by a unit of time, which can be hours (h), minutes (m), or seconds (s). For example, specify 30 seconds as 30s. You can include multiple values in a single entry. For example, 1m30s is equivalent to 90 seconds. (Default value: "30m")

param.name: maxPoolSize
param.doc: Maximum number of physical connections for a pool. A value of 0 means unlimited. (Default value: 50)

param.name: minPoolSize
param.doc: Minimum number of physical connections to maintain in the pool. The pool is not pre-populated. Aged timeout can override the minimum.

param.name: numConnectionsPerThreadLocal
param.doc: Caches the specified number of connections for each thread.

param.name: purgePolicy
param.doc: Specifies which connections to destroy when a stale connection is detected in a pool. Valid values are: EntirePool (When a stale connection is detected, all connections in the pool are marked stale, and when no longer in use, are closed.) FailingConnectionOnly (When a stale connection is detected, only the connection which was found to be bad is closed.) ValidateAllConnections (When a stale connection is detected, connections are tested and those found to be bad are closed.) (Default value: "EntirePool")

param.name: reapTime
param.doc: Amount of time between runs of the pool maintenance thread. A value of -1 disables pool maintenance. Specify a positive integer followed by a unit of time, which can be hours (h), minutes (m), or seconds (s). For example, specify 30 seconds as 30s. You can include multiple values in a single entry. For example, 1m30s is equivalent to 90 seconds. (Default value: "3m")

param.name: hostName
param.doc: The IP address or hostname of the LDAP server.

param.name: hostPort
param.doc: The port that the LDAP server is listening on.

param.name: bindDN
param.doc: The distinguished name to use to bind to the LDAP server.

param.name: bindPwd
param.doc: The password for bindDN to use when binding to the LDAP server. Note: The password is not returned in responses. When updating a connection, this parameter is optional.

param.name: ssl
param.doc: Controls whether SSL is used to establish the connection.

param.name: sslTruststore
param.doc: The key database to be used as an SSL truststore.

param.name: sslAuthKey
param.doc: The name of the key which should be used during mutual authentication with the LDAP server.

param.name: connectTimeout
param.doc: Amount of time, in seconds, after which a connection to the LDAP server times out.

param.name: idleTimeout
param.doc: Amount of time, in seconds, after which an established connection will be discarded as idle. Set this to a value lower than the connection idle timeout on the LDAP server. This value is only used when connections are pooled, currently this is only done when performing attribute mapping

param.name: maxPoolSize
param.doc: Number of connections which will be pooled.

param.name: order
param.doc: The order of precedence for this server.

param.name: uuid
param.doc: A unique identifier for this connection. (Automatically generated, only visible in responses)

param.name: connection
param.doc: The connection properties.

param.name: connectionManager
param.doc: The connection manager properties.

param.name: hostName
param.doc: The IP address or hostname of the SMTP server.

param.name: hostPort
param.doc: The port that the SMTP server is listening on.

param.name: user
param.doc: The user name to authenticate to the SMTP server.

param.name: password
param.doc: The password used to to authenticate with the SMTP server. Note: The password is not returned in responses. When updating a connection, this parameter is optional.

param.name: ssl
param.doc: Controls whether SSL is used to establish the connection.

param.name: connectTimeout
param.doc: Amount of time, in seconds, after which a connection to the SMTP server times out.

param.name: url
param.doc: The fully qualified URL of the web service endpoint, including the protocol, host/IP, port and path. Do not include a trailing slash '/' in this URL. If a trailing slash is included, the web service will remove it.

param.name: user
param.doc: The user name to authenticate to the web service.

param.name: password
param.doc: The password used to to authenticate with the web service. Note: The password is not returned in responses. When updating a connection, this parameter is optional.

param.name: ssl
param.doc: Controls whether SSL is used to establish the connection.

param.name: sslTruststore
param.doc: The key database to be used as an SSL truststore. This field is required when "ssl" is true.

param.name: sslAuthKey
param.doc: The name of the key which should be used during mutual authentication with the web server.

param.name: adminHost
param.doc: The IBM Security Verify administration host to connect to.

param.name: clientId
param.doc: The client ID to authenticate to the IBM Security Verify tenant.

param.name: clientSecret
param.doc: The client secret to authenticate to the IBM Security Verify tenant.

param.name: ssl
param.doc: Controls whether SSL is used to establish the connection.

param.name: sslTruststore
param.doc: The key database to be used as an SSL truststore. This field is required when "ssl" is true.

param.name: sslAuthKey
param.doc: The name of the key which should be used during mutual authentication with the web server.

param.name: usersEndpoint
param.doc: The versioned endpoint for user requests.

param.name: authorizeEndpoint
param.doc: The versioned endpoint for authorization requests.

param.name: authenticatorsEndpoint
param.doc: The versioned endpoint for authenticator requests.

param.name: authnmethodsEndpoint
param.doc: The DEPRECATED versioned endpoint for authentication method requests.

param.name: factorsEndpoint
param.doc: The versioned endpoint for factors requests.

param.name: bindDN
param.doc: The distinguished name to use to bind to the Verify Access Runtime LDAP server.

param.name: bindPwd
param.doc: The password for bindDN to use when binding to the Verify Access Runtime LDAP server. Note: The password is not returned in responses. When updating a connection, this parameter is optional.

param.name: ssl
param.doc: Controls whether SSL is used to establish the connection.

param.name: sslTruststore
param.doc: The key database to be used as an SSL truststore. This field is required when "ssl" is true.

param.name: sslAuthKey
param.doc: The name of the key which should be used during mutual authentication with the Verify Access runtime LDAP server.

param.name: deploymentModel
param.doc: The Redis deployment model. Valid values are standalone and sentinel.

param.name: masterName
param.doc: The key used in the redis sentinel node to store the master/slave configuration. This is only required if the deploymentModel is set as sentinel.

param.name: hostName
param.doc: The IP address or hostname of the Redis server. This is only required if the deploymentModel is set as standalone.

param.name: hostPort
param.doc: The port that the Redis server is listening on. This is only required if the deploymentModel is set as standalone.

param.name: userName
param.doc: The user name to authenticate to the Redis server.

param.name: password
param.doc: The password used to to authenticate with the Redis server. Note: The password is not returned in responses.

param.name: ssl
param.doc: Controls whether SSL is used to establish the connection. Defaults to false if not specified.

param.name: sslTruststore
param.doc: The key database to be used as an SSL truststore. Only required if ssl is set to true.

param.name: sslKeystore
param.doc: The key database to be used as an SSL keystore. Only required if ssl is set to true.

param.name: sslKeystoreLabel
param.doc: The name of the key which should be used during mutual authentication with the Redis server.

param.name: connectTimeout
param.doc: Amount of time, in seconds, after which a connection to the Redis server times out.

param.name: idleTimeout
param.doc: Amount of time, in seconds, after which an established connection will be discarded as idle. Set this to a value lower than the connection idle timeout on the Redis server. This value is only used when connections are pooled, currently this is only done when performing attribute mapping

param.name: maxPoolSize
param.doc: Number of connections which will be pooled.

param.name: minIdleSize
param.doc: The minimum number of idle connections in the pool.

param.name: maxIdleSize
param.doc: The maximum number of idle connections in the pool.

param.name: ioTimeout
param.doc: Amount of time, in seconds, after which the connection socket will timeout.

param.name: uuid
param.doc: A unique identifier for this connection. (Automatically generated, only visible in responses)

param.name: hostName
param.doc: The IP address or hostname of the Redis server.

param.name: hostPort
param.doc: The port that the Redis server is listening on.
